items.title: Skip Global Middleware for specific Rout in Laravel 5.3
items.body:
I created one global Middleware and it works perfectly fine for all the Routs but now i need to skip one Rout from that Middleware Following is My MIddleware and Routs and Kernal.php file

MIddleware:Check shop

<?php
namespace App\Http\Middleware;
use Closure;
class Checkshop
{
/**
 * Handle an incoming request.
 *
 * @param  \Illuminate\Http\Request  $request
 * @param  \Closure  $next
 * @return mixed
 */
public function handle($request, Closure $next)
{   
    if(session('shop'))
        {
            $shop = session('shop');
        }
    else{
            if($request['shop'])
            {
                session(['shop' => $request['shop']]);
                $shop = session('shop');
            }
            else{
                dd('session expiere');
            }

        }

    return $next($request);
 }
}

Kernal.php

<?php
namespace App\Http;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Http\Kernel as HttpKernel;
class Kernel extends HttpKernel
{
/**

 *

 */

    \Illuminate\Foundation\Http\Middleware\CheckForMaintenanceMode::class,
];

/**
 * The application's route middleware groups.
 *
 * @var array
 */
protected $middlewareGroups = [
    'web' => [
        \App\Http\Middleware\EncryptCookies::class,
        \Illuminate\Cookie\Middleware\AddQueuedCookiesToResponse::class,
        \Illuminate\Session\Middleware\StartSession::class,
        \Illuminate\View\Middleware\ShareErrorsFromSession::class,
        \App\Http\Middleware\VerifyCsrfToken::class,
        \Illuminate\Routing\Middleware\SubstituteBindings::class,
        \App\Http\Middleware\Checkshop::class,
    ],

    'api' => [
        'throttle:60,1',
        'bindings',
    ],
];

/**
 * The application's route middleware.
 *
 * These middleware may be assigned to groups or used individually.
 *
 * @var array
 */
protected $routeMiddleware = [
    'auth' => \Illuminate\Auth\Middleware\Authenticate::class,
    'auth.basic' => \Illuminate\Auth\Middleware\AuthenticateWithBasicAuth::class,
    'bindings' => \Illuminate\Routing\Middleware\SubstituteBindings::class,
    'can' => \Illuminate\Auth\Middleware\Authorize::class,
    'guest' => \App\Http\Middleware\RedirectIfAuthenticated::class,
    'throttle' => \Illuminate\Routing\Middleware\ThrottleRequests::class,
    'cors' => \App\Http\Middleware\Cors::class,

 ];
}

Web.php

return view('welcome');
});

Route::any('order','orderController@index')->name('order');

items.body_markdown:
In my application I would like to execute the query (which, as a .sql script, works correctly):

    SELECT jobs.job_title, employees.last_name, job_history.start_date, job_history.end_date
    FROM jobs
    JOIN job_history
        ON jobs.job_id = job_history.job_id
    JOIN employees
        ON job_history.employee_id = employees.employee_id;
After executing above query I receive: "illegal attempt to dereference collection". I searched for some answers, which may help to overcome it and tried to reproduce them to my case in that way (a little bit simplier query):

    SELECT jh.start_date, jh.end_date, j.job_title
    FROM job_history jh
    JOIN jh.job j
    WHERE j.job_title != 'a' -- or any other always fulfilled statement;
but I receive "could not execute the query". The objects `job` and `employee` are mapped in class JobHistory using `@ManyToOne(fetch=FetchType.EAGER)` and `@JoinColumn(name="(...)")` and `@OneToMany(mappedBy = "(...)")` in the corresponding classes. Could you tell me how should I build the (EDIT: first) query?
items.title: Hibernate: illegal attempt to dereference collection and could not execute the query
items.body:
In my application I would like to execute the query (which, as a .sql script, works correctly):

SELECT jobs.job_title, employees.last_name, job_history.start_date, job_history.end_date
FROM jobs
JOIN job_history
    ON jobs.job_id = job_history.job_id
JOIN employees
    ON job_history.employee_id = employees.employee_id;

After executing above query I receive: "illegal attempt to dereference collection". I searched for some answers, which may help to overcome it and tried to reproduce them to my case in that way (a little bit simplier query):

SELECT jh.start_date, jh.end_date, j.job_title
FROM job_history jh
JOIN jh.job j
WHERE j.job_title != 'a' -- or any other always fulfilled statement;

but I receive "could not execute the query". The objects job and employee are mapped in class JobHistory using @ManyToOne(fetch=FetchType.EAGER) and @JoinColumn(name="(...)") and @OneToMany(mappedBy = "(...)") in the corresponding classes. Could you tell me how should I build the (EDIT: first) query?

items.title: integrate jQuery object in angular 5
items.body:
i'm working with angular 5, and tried to make a multiple range slider.
hopefully, i found the Elessar plugin, that do exactly what i need, but doesn't have an angular version (there is angularJs but angular 5 is needed in my case).
it also requires jQuery, and Estira, and after a hard 12 hours, i made it work, to create the jQuery object that will hold the range slider, like the above example (here is the source code)

the $.prepend() function, add the jquery object to it's container, but the dragging and sliding effects and all other events are unreached.
in other words, the jquery is presented, as a plain HTML, without event listeners, that handles the range slider.

import { Component, OnInit, AfterViewInit, Renderer2, ViewChild, NgZone } from '@angular/core';
declare var jquery: any, $: any;
declare var require: any;
import 'estira/index.js';
import 'elessar/dist/elessar.js';

declare var System: any;


@Component({
  selector: 'fuse-branch-timesheet-form',
  templateUrl: './branch-timesheet-form.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./branch-timesheet-form.component.scss'],

})
export class BranchTimesheetFormComponent implements OnInit, AfterViewInit {

  r: any;
  @ViewChild('myButton') myButton;



  constructor(private renderer: Renderer2, private zone: NgZone) {}

  ngOnInit() {}

  ngAfterViewInit() {
    System.import('elessar/dist/elessar.js').then(RangeBar => {
      $('#dds').prepend(RangeBar({
        min: 0,
        max: 100,
        values: [
          [5,30],
          [50,70],
        ],
        label: function(a){return JSON.stringify(a); },
        snap: 1,
        minSize: 10,
        bgLabels: 4,
      }).on('changing', function(ev, ranges, changed) {
        console.log(changed);
        $('pre.changing').html(JSON.stringify(ranges, null, 2));
      }).on('change', function(ev, ranges, changed) {
        console.log(changed);
        $('pre.changing').after($('<pre>').html('changed' + JSON.stringify(ranges, null, 2)));
      }).$el);

      console.log(this.r);

    });
}



}

my question is, how to integrate a jquery object in a component, with garding, all the events on it, like in the demo.

i will be grateful, if anyone, could show an example in plnkr or stackblitz.

thank you.

items.title: Sorting multiple lists with Guava
items.body:
List<Integer> indexes = new ArrayList<>();
for (int i = 0; i < myListCopy.size(); i++) {
    indexes.add(i);
}
Multimap<String, Integer> multiMap = LinkedListMultimap.create();
for (int i = 0; i < myListCopy.size(); i++) {
    multiMap.put(myListCopy.get(i), indexes.get(i));
}
for (String name : Ordering.natural().sortedCopy(multiMap.keys())) {           
    for (Integer value : multiMap.get(name)) {
        myList.add(name);      
        sortedIndexes.add(value);
    }
}

for (int i=0; i<sortedIndexes.size(); i++) {
    myListNo1.add(myListTemp1.get(sortedIndexes.get(i)));
    myListNo2.add(myListTemp2.get(sortedIndexes.get(i)));
    myListNo3.add(myListTemp3.get(sortedIndexes.get(i)));
    myListNo4.add(myListTemp4.get(sortedIndexes.get(i)));
}

I have multiple lists. I have to sort one, and link data in others according to the sorted one. Values can be the same in all lists. For example:

list1 = A, B, A, C, B

list2 = 1, 2, 1, 3, 2

list3 = first, second, first, third, second

list 4 = 1.2, 5, 7.3, 9, 11.7

When I sort, for example, by list3, the result must be...

list1 = A, A, B, B, C

list2 = 1, 1, 2, 2, 3

list3 = first, first, second, second, third

list4 = 1.2, 7.4, 5, 11.7, 7.3

...and the code above is working perfectly.

But when you sort by list4 or list2, I get wrong results. Can you tell what am I doing wrong here?

items.body:

$reader = new Csv();

        $spreadsheet = $reader->load($request->csv->getRealPath());

        $worksheet = $spreadsheet->getActiveSheet();

        $apartmentKeys = collect(['name', 'city', 'category', 'apartment_category', 'total_size', 'clean_size', 'exposure', 'floor', 'building', 'comment', 'cellar', 'price_per_square']);
        $apartments = collect([]);

        foreach ($worksheet->getRowIterator() as $row) {
            $apartmentValues = collect([]);

            $cellIterator = $row->getCellIterator();
            $cellIterator->setIterateOnlyExistingCells(FALSE);

            if ($row->getRowIndex() == 1) {
                $apartmentCellKeys = collect([]);

                foreach ($cellIterator as $cell) {
                    $apartmentCellKeys->push($cell->getValue());
                }

                // If the keys from the csv does not match the $apartmentKeys template
                $diff = $apartmentKeys->diff($apartmentCellKeys);
                if ($diff->count()) {
                    return redirect()->back()->with('error', 'The csv file does not match the required template. Check the exmaple file');
                }
            } else {
                fordeach ($cellIterator as $cell) {
                    return dd($cell);
                    $apartmentValues->push($cell->getValue());
                }

                $apartments->push($apartmentKeys->combine($apartmentValues));
            }
        }

        return dd($apartments);

How can I make it accept cyrillic values ?

items.body_markdown:
I want to develop an Operating System just like the one that runs on a `PLC`. 
In a `PLC`, the user can make his custom programs in `PLC` programming language which is like `C` language with very specific functionality. For example, the user can write a program to take inputs from digital pins and give processed output at defined output pins. The Operating System of `PLC` receives this program via serial communications port and runs it in loop along with additional diagnostic tasks.

I want to know how to get started on this type of Operating System development. Any resources would be appreciated.
items.title: What are the steps to develop an Operating System on a microcontroller and enable a user to run custom programs to run on this OS?
items.body:

In a PLC, the user can make his custom programs in PLC programming language which is like C language with very specific functionality. For example, the user can write a program to take inputs from digital pins and give processed output at defined output pins. The Operating System of PLC receives this program via serial communications port and runs it in loop along with additional diagnostic tasks.

I want to know how to get started on this type of Operating System development. Any resources would be appreciated.

Basically, I'm sending two emails out using mailgun-js to the user and to the admin, even though the sending is successful and stuff, I still get the same warning in my logs.

exports.sendSample = functions.database
.ref( 'sample/{pushID}' )
.onWrite( event => {

    //  only trigger if it's new
    if ( !event.data.exists() || event.data.previous.exists() ) return 0

    const e = event.data.val()

    const toUser = {
        to      : `${ e.email }`,
        from    : `xxx`,
        subject : `xxx`,
        html    : `xxx`
    }

    const toAdmin = {
        to      : `${ e.admin }`,
        from    : `xxx`,
        subject : `xxx`,
        html    : `xxx`
    }

    //  send sms
    if ( e.mobile !== 'none' ) {
        return client.messages.create({
            body : `xxx`,
            to   : `${e.mobile}`,
            from : `xxx`
        })
        .then( message => {
            sendEmail()
            return message.sid
        })
        .catch( err => {
            return err
        })
    } else {
        sendEmail()
    }

    //  send email
    function sendEmail() {
        if ( e.email !== 'none' ) {
            return mailgun.messages().send( toUser, ( err, body ) => {
                return ( err, body )
                return mailgun.messages().send( toAdmin, ( err, body ) => {
                    return ( err, body )
                })
            })
        } else {
            return true
        }
    }
})

items.title: 348. Design Tic-Tac-Toe Stefan Pochmann Solution
items.body:
I was working on a Tic-Tac-Toe solution on Leetcode and I saw one of the solutions there by Stefan Pochmann. I was hoping if someone could help me understand what is the logic behind the code in Python and how is he using the enumerate function.

class TicTacToe(object):
    def __init__(self, n):
        count = collections.Counter()
        def move(row, col, player):
            for i, x in enumerate((row, col, row+col, row-col)):
                count[i, x, player] += 1
                if count[i, x, player] == n:
                    return player
            return 0
        self.move = move

items.title: postgres 9.6 - recursive query CTE for hierachical data - distinct - duplicated rows
items.body:
I'm using Postgres 9.6 and I'm trying to recreate the level structure from a table with parents relationships.

I used a WITH RECURSIVE query; what I'm trying to do is to fetch for each employee_id the one with max level, but I'm messing up something, since despite using DISTINCT, there are still duplicated rows.

code:

-- source table 1
nov=# select comp_user_id, id from corp_companyuserprofile limit 10;
   comp_user_id   | id
------------------+----
 ffadmin          |  1
 clientadmin      |  4
 ca               |  5
 GGAdmin bb .     |  9
 comp_pa          | 10
 DEONI2           | 11
 RNoeleded        | 12
 asuhguhbnd       | 13
 KxxxxChan        | 14
 nmwaffmin        | 15

-- source table 2
nov=# select * from company_managerrelation limit 10;
  id  | mgr_type | employee_id | manager_id
------+----------+-------------+------------
 3932 | mgr      |         485 |         15
 3933 | mgr      |         526 |        527
 3934 | ind_mgr  |         351 |        304
 3935 | mgr      |         617 |        619
 3936 | ind_mgr  |         184 |         43
 3937 | mgr      |        1033 |       1023
 3938 | ind_mgr  |         312 |         25
 3939 | mgr      |         566 |        541
 3940 | mgr      |         394 |        390
 3941 | mgr      |         438 |        462

-- getting hierarchical structure with levels
with recursive cup_from_parents as
(
  select c.id, c.comp_user_id, '{}' :: int [] as parents, 0 as level,
   m.employee_id, m.manager_id
 from corp_companyuserprofile c LEFT JOIN corp_managerrelation m
     on c.id = m.employee_id
 where m.manager_id is NULL
 union all
  select c.id, c.comp_user_id, parents || m.manager_id, level+1,
       m.employee_id, m.manager_id
  from cup_from_parents p
  join corp_managerrelation m
  on m.manager_id = p.id
  join corp_companyuserprofile c
  on c.id = m.employee_id
  where not c.id = any(parents)
)
select gg.id, gg.comp_user_id, gg.parents, max(gg.level) as max_level from (
  select distinct on (cfp.id, cfp.parents, cfp.comp_user_id, cfp.level) cfp.id, cfp.comp_user_id, cfp.parents, cfp.level
  from cup_from_parents cfp
  join corp_managerrelation cmr
  on cfp.id = cmr.employee_id
) as gg
  group by (gg.id, gg.comp_user_id, gg.parents, gg.level)
order by gg.level DESC;

items.title: Using same fragment for several tabs in Kotlin, Android
items.body:
I'm really a beginner, so please be patient.

I have a 4 tabs app, and use the same fragment for the 4 tabs. In said fragment (fragment_main.xml) I have an editText and in the main_activity.xml a FAB. The fab only displays a toast with the text in the editText. The problem is it doesn't matter in which tab I am in, it shows the text from another tab or sometimes the corresponding text, randomly.

        fab.setOnClickListener {view ->
        var search: EditText = findViewById(R.id.search)

        Toast.makeText(this@MainActivity, search.text, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
    }

Do I have to use a different fragment for each tab? All the tabs will be the same: a search field, a listView and the FAB which will send the data to the database and clear said tab.

I already tried to change the editText id adding the tab number to it, but it didn't work. Any other suggestions?
